void _5_4_1_Conversion_and_Scalar_Constructors()
{
    ISOK(int(_uint);) // converts an unsigned integer to a signed integer
    ISOK(int(_bool);) // converts a Boolean value to an int
    ISOK(int(_float);) // converts a float value to an int
    RSVD(int(_double);) // converts a double value to a signed integer
    ISOK(uint(_int);) // converts a signed integer value to an unsigned integer
    ISOK(uint(_bool);) // converts a Boolean value to an unsigned integer
    ISOK(uint(_float);) // converts a float value to an unsigned integer
    RSVD(uint(_double);) // converts a double value to an unsigned integer
    ISOK(bool(_int);) // converts a signed integer value to a Boolean
    ISOK(bool(_uint);) // converts an unsigned integer value to a Boolean value
    ISOK(bool(_float);) // converts a float value to a Boolean
    RSVD(bool(_double);) // converts a double value to a Boolean
    ISOK(float(_int);) // converts a signed integer value to a float
    ISOK(float(_uint);) // converts an unsigned integer value to a float value
    ISOK(float(_bool);) // converts a Boolean value to a float
    RSVD(float(_double);) // converts a double value to a float
    RSVD(double(_int);) // converts a signed integer value to a double
    RSVD(double(_uint);) // converts an unsigned integer value to a double
    RSVD(double(_bool);) // converts a Boolean value to a double
    RSVD(double(_float);) // converts a float value to a double
}

void _5_4_2_Vector_and_Matrix_Constructors()
{
    ISOK(vec3(_float);) // initializes each component of the vec3 with the float
	ISOK(vec4(_ivec4);) // makes a vec4 with component-wise conversion
	ISOK(vec4(_mat2);) // the vec4 is column 0 followed by column 1
	ISOK(vec2(_float, _float);) // initializes a vec2 with 2 floats
	ISOK(ivec3(_int, _int, _int);) // initializes an ivec3 with 3 ints
	ISOK(bvec4(_int, _int, _float, _float);) // uses 4 Boolean conversions
	ISOK(vec2(_vec3);) // drops the third component of a vec3
	ISOK(vec3(_vec4);) // drops the fourth component of a vec4
	ISOK(vec3(_vec2, _float);) // vec3.x = vec2.x, vec3.y = vec2.y, vec3.z = float
	ISOK(vec3(_float, _vec2);) // vec3.x = float, vec3.y = vec2.x, vec3.z = vec2.y
	ISOK(vec4(_vec3, _float);)
	ISOK(vec4(_float, _vec3);)
	ISOK(vec4(_vec2, _vec2);)

	ISOK(vec4 color = vec4(0.0, 1.0, 0.0, 1.0);)
	ISOK(vec4 rgba = vec4(1.0);) // sets each component to 1.0
	ISOK(vec3 rgb = vec3(color);) // drop the 4th component

	ISOK(mat2(_float);)
	ISOK(mat3(_float);)
	ISOK(mat4(_float);)

	ISOK(mat2(_vec2, _vec2);) // one column per argument
	ISOK(mat3(_vec3, _vec3, _vec3);) // one column per argument
	ISOK(mat4(_vec4, _vec4, _vec4, _vec4);) // one column per argument
	ISOK(mat3x2(_vec2, _vec2, _vec2);) // one column per argument
    RSVD(dmat2(_dvec2, _dvec2);)
	RSVD(dmat3(_dvec3, _dvec3, _dvec3);)
	RSVD(dmat4(_dvec4, _dvec4, _dvec4, _dvec4);)
	ISOK(mat2(_float, _float, // first column
	 _float, _float);) // second column
	ISOK(mat3(_float, _float, _float, // first column
	 _float, _float, _float, // second column
	 _float, _float, _float);) // third column
	ISOK(mat4(_float, _float, _float, _float, // first column
	 _float, _float, _float, _float, // second column
	 _float, _float, _float, _float, // third column
	 _float, _float, _float, _float);) // fourth column
	ISOK(mat2x3(_vec2, _float, // first column
	 _vec2, _float);) // second column
	RSVD(dmat2x4(_dvec3, _double, // first column
	 _double, _dvec3);) // second column

	ISOK(mat3x3(_mat4x4);) // takes the upper-left 3x3 of the mat4x4
	ISOK(mat2x3(_mat4x2);) // takes the upper-left 2x2 of the mat4x4, last row is 0,0
	ISOK(mat4x4(_mat3x3);) // puts the mat3x3 in the upper-left, sets the lower right
	 // component to 1, and the rest to 0
}

void _5_4_3_StructureConstructors()
{
    struct light {
     float intensity;
     vec3 position;
    };
    light lightVar = light(3.0, vec3(1.0, 2.0, 3.0));
}

void _5_4_4_ArrayConstructors()
{
    {
        const float c[3] = float[3](5.0, 7.2, 1.1);
        const float d[3] = float[](5.0, 7.2, 1.1);
        float g;
        // ...
        float a[5] = float[5](g, 1.0, g, 2.3, g);
        float b[3];
        b = float[3](g, g + 1.0, g + 2.0);
    }
    {
        vec4 b[2];
        RSVD(vec4[3][2](b, b, b);) // constructor
        RSVD(vec4[][2](b, b, b);) // constructor, valid, size deduced
        RSVD(vec4[3][](b, b, b);) // constructor, valid, size deduced
        RSVD(vec4[][](b, b, b);)
    }
}

void _5_5_Vector_and_Scalar_Components_and_Length()
{
    {
        vec2 pos;
        float height;
        pos.x; // is legal
        ILGL(pos.z;) // is illegal
        SNTX(height.x;) // is legal
        ILGL(height.y;) // is illegal
    }
    {
        vec4 v4;
        v4.rgba; // is a vec4 and the same as just using v4,
        v4.rgb; // is a vec3,
        v4.b; // is a float,
        v4.xy; // is a vec2,
        ILGL(v4.xgba;) // is illegal - the component names do not come from the same set
    }
    {
        vec4 v4;
        ILGL(v4.xyzwxy;) // is illegal since it has 6 components
        ILGL((v4.xyzwxy).xy;) // is illegal since the intermediate value has 6 components
    }
    {
        vec4 pos = vec4(1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0);
        vec4 swiz = pos.wzyx; // swiz = (4.0, 3.0, 2.0, 1.0)
        vec4 dup = pos.xxyy; // dup = (1.0, 1.0, 2.0, 2.0)
    }
    {
        vec4 pos = vec4(1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0);
        pos.xw = vec2(5.0, 6.0); // pos = (5.0, 2.0, 3.0, 6.0)
        pos.wx = vec2(7.0, 8.0); // pos = (8.0, 2.0, 3.0, 7.0)
        ILGL(pos.xx = vec2(3.0, 4.0);) // illegal - 'x' used twice
        ILGL(pos.xy = vec3(1.0, 2.0, 3.0);) // illegal - mismatch between vec2 and vec3
    }
    {
        vec3 v;
        SNTX(const int L = v.length();)
    }
}

void _5_6_Matrix_Components()
{
    {
        mat4 m;
        m[1] = vec4(2.0); // sets the second column to all 2.0
        m[0][0] = 1.0; // sets the upper left element to 1.0
        m[2][3] = 2.0; // sets the 4th element of the third column to 2.0
    }
    {
        mat3x4 v;
        SNTX(const int L = v.length();)
    }
}

void _5_7_Structure_and_Array_Operations()
{
    float diffuseColor, NdotL;
    float lightIntensity[4];
    diffuseColor += lightIntensity[3] * NdotL;
    lightIntensity.length(); // return the size of the array
}

void _5_10_Vector_and_Matrix_Operations()
{
    {
        vec3 v, u;
        float f;
        v = u + f;
        v.x = u.x + f;
        v.y = u.y + f;
        v.z = u.z + f;
    }
    {
        vec3 v, u, w;
        w = v + u;
        w.x = v.x + u.x;
        w.y = v.y + u.y;
        w.z = v.z + u.z;
    }
    {
        vec3 v, u;
        mat3 m;
        u = v * m;
        u.x = dot(v, m[0]); // m[0] is the left column of m
        u.y = dot(v, m[1]); // dot(a,b) is the inner (dot) product of a and b
        u.z = dot(v, m[2]);
        u = m * v;
        u.x = m[0].x * v.x + m[1].x * v.y + m[2].x * v.z;
        u.y = m[0].y * v.x + m[1].y * v.y + m[2].y * v.z;
        u.z = m[0].z * v.x + m[1].z * v.y + m[2].z * v.z;
    }
    {
        mat3 m, n, r;
        r = m * n;
        r[0].x = m[0].x * n[0].x + m[1].x * n[0].y + m[2].x * n[0].z;
        r[1].x = m[0].x * n[1].x + m[1].x * n[1].y + m[2].x * n[1].z;
        r[2].x = m[0].x * n[2].x + m[1].x * n[2].y + m[2].x * n[2].z;
        r[0].y = m[0].y * n[0].x + m[1].y * n[0].y + m[2].y * n[0].z;
        r[1].y = m[0].y * n[1].x + m[1].y * n[1].y + m[2].y * n[1].z;
        r[2].y = m[0].y * n[2].x + m[1].y * n[2].y + m[2].y * n[2].z;
        r[0].z = m[0].z * n[0].x + m[1].z * n[0].y + m[2].z * n[0].z;
        r[1].z = m[0].z * n[1].x + m[1].z * n[1].y + m[2].z * n[1].z;
        r[2].z = m[0].z * n[2].x + m[1].z * n[2].y + m[2].z * n[2].z;
    }
}

void func1() { }
ILGL(void func2() { return func1(); }) // illegal return statement

vec4 f(in vec4 x, out vec4 y) { return _vec4; } // (A)
vec4 f(in vec4 x, out uvec4 y) { return _vec4; } // (B) okay, different argument type
RSVD(vec4 f(in ivec4 x, out dvec4 y);) // (C) okay, different argument type
ILGL(int f(in vec4 x, out vec4 y);) // error, only return type differs
ILGL(vec4 f(in vec4 x, in vec4 y);) // error, only qualifier differs
ILGL(vec4 f(const in vec4 x, out vec4 y);) // error, only qualifier differs

void _6_1_test()
{
    f(_vec4, _vec4); // exact match of vec4 f(in vec4 x, out vec4 y)
    f(_vec4, _uvec4); // exact match of vec4 f(in vec4 x, out uvec4 y)
    OVRL(f(_vec4, _ivec4);) // matched to vec4 f(in vec4 x, out vec4 y)
     // (C) not relevant, can't convert vec4 to
     // ivec4. (A) better than (B) for 2nd
     // argument (rule 3), same on first argument.
    ILGL(f(_ivec4, _vec4);) // NOT matched. All three match by implicit
     // conversion. (C) is better than (A) and (B)
     // on the first argument. (A) is better than
     // (B) and (C).
}

void mainImage( out vec4 fragColor, in vec2 fragCoord )
{
    // Normalized pixel coordinates (from 0 to 1)
    vec2 uv = fragCoord/iResolution.xy;

    // Time varying pixel color
    vec3 col = 0.5 + 0.5*cos(iTime+uv.xyx+vec3(0,2,4));

    // Output to screen
    fragColor = vec4(col,1.0);
}
